intro: Zappania hispida, commonly known as the hairy zappania, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to certain regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, yellowish flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Zappania hispida is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats.
